org.tmotte.tmplz.load.builtin

Class ServletContextTextLoaderFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.tmplz.load.builtin.URLTextLoaderFactory
      • org.tmotte.tmplz.load.builtin.ServletContextTextLoaderFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextLoaderFactory

    public class ServletContextTextLoaderFactory
extends URLTextLoaderFactory

    Uses javax.servlet.ServletContext to locate resources within a web application's file hierarchy via ServletContext.getResource(). Paths passed to TemplateManager.getTemplate() should should start with a "/" character (or pass such as prePath to ServletContextTextLoaderFactory(servletContext, prePath)). Relative paths in Include tags are allowed, since this class extends URLTextLoaderFactory.

    Note: Much to our dissapointment, recent/certain versions of Tomcat do not properly handle URL's which (correctly) use %20 to represent space characters in the file name.

      TextLoader create(Path path)
      Returns a TextLoader when the path.hasURL() returns true, or when path.getPathString() has a leading "/" (including the prePath passed to the constructor); otherwise returns null.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public TextLoader create(Path path)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a TextLoader when the path.hasURL() returns true, or when path.getPathString() has a leading "/" (including the prePath passed to the constructor); otherwise returns null. Uses URLTextLoader internally.
        Specified by:
        create in interface TextLoaderFactory
        Overrides:
        create in class URLTextLoaderFactory
        Returns:
        If path.hasURL() returns true, a URLTextLoader is created with path.getURL(). If path.hasPathString() returns true, the "prePath" value passed to the constructor ("" by default) will be prepended to path.getPathString(), and new URL(String) will be invoked with it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • convertPath

        public Path convertPath(java.lang.String path,
               java.lang.String prePath,
               javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
